list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight
list.description: private highlight that's used internally and does not fire callbacks

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight~doBeginMatch
list.description: Handle the start of a new potential mode match

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight~doEndMatch
list.description: Handle the potential end of mode

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight~doIgnore
list.description: Handle matching but then ignoring a sequence of text

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight~keywordData
list.description: Return keyword data if a match is a keyword

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~_highlight~processLexeme
list.description: Process an individual match

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~autoDetection
list.description: Determines if a given language has auto-detection enabled

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~configure
list.description: Updates highlight.js global options with the passed options

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~highlight
list.description: Core highlighting function.OLD APIhighlight(lang, code, ignoreIllegals, continuation)NEW APIhighlight(code, {lang, ignoreIllegals})

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~highlightAll
list.description: auto-highlights all pre>code elements on the page

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~highlightAuto
list.description:
Highlighting with language detection. Accepts a string with the code to
    highlight. Returns an object with the following properties:

    - language (detected language)
    - relevance (int)
    - value (an HTML string with highlighting markup)
    - secondBest (object with the same structure for second-best heuristically
      detected language, may be absent)

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~highlightElement
list.description: Applies highlighting to a DOM node containing code.

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~justTextHighlightResult
list.description: returns a valid highlight result, without actually doing any actual work,auto highlight starts with this and it's possible for small snippets thatauto-detection may not find a better match

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~registerLanguage
list.description: Register a language grammar module

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~shouldNotHighlight
list.description: Tests a language name to see if highlighting should be skipped

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~unregisterLanguage
list.description: Remove a language grammar module

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~updateClassName
list.description: Builds new class name for block given the language name

list.title: <anonymous>~HLJS~upgradePluginAPI
list.description: Upgrades the old highlightBlock plugins to the newhighlightElement API

list.title: <anonymous>~compileKeywords~compileList
list.description: Compiles an individual list of keywordsEx: "for if when while|5"

list.title: <anonymous>~compileLanguage~buildModeRegex
list.description: Given a mode, builds a huge ResumableMultiRegex that can be used to walkthe content and find matches.

list.title: <anonymous>~compileLanguage~compileMode
list.description: Compiles an individual modeThis can raise an error if the mode contains certain detectable known logicissues.

list.title: <anonymous>~compileLanguage~langRe
list.description: Builds a regex with the case sensitivity of the current language

list.title: <anonymous>~javascript~hasClosingTag
list.description: Takes a string like "<Booger" and checks to seeif we can find a matching "</Booger" later in thecontent.

list.description: Initialize tocbot.

list.description: Refresh tocbot.

list.title: apiErrorHandler
list.description: Error handler for API requests.

list.title: auth
list.description: Middleware for authentication.

list.title: auth.authentify
list.description:
Authenticates a user based on their username and password.
This function first looks for a user with the provided username in the database.
If a user is found,
it then checks whether the provided password matches the one stored in the database.
If the password is correct, it also fetches the user's roles and permissions.
The method finally returns an object with the user data and their roles and permissions.
If no user is found or if the password is incorrect, it returns false.

list.title: auth.authorize
list.description:
The function retrieves the access JWT from the request,
decodes it, and verifies it against the JWT_SECRET.
It also checks if the IP address stored in the token matches the IP address of the request,
specifically the first three segments of the IP.
If the token is valid and the IP addresses match, the function proceeds to the next middleware.
If the token is invalid or the IP addresses do not match, it throws a 401 error.

list.title: auth.generateAccessToken
list.description:
Generates a JSON Web Token (JWT) for a user.
The token is signed with a secret and includes the user's IP address,
ID, username, roles, and permissions.
The JWT expires after a predetermined time period defined in ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRATION.

list.title: auth.generateRefreshToken
list.description:
Generates a JSON Web Token (JWT) as a refresh token for a user.
The refresh token is signed with a separate secret and only includes the user's ID.
The JWT expires after a predetermined time period defined in REFRESH_TOKEN_EXPIRATION.
The function also updates the refresh token in the user's record in the database.

list.title: auth.getAccessJWT
list.description:
Retrieves the access JSON Web Token (JWT) from the request's authorization header.
The function checks if the authorization header is provided in the request.

list.title: auth.getAccessTokenUser
list.description:
Retrieves the user associated with an access token.
The function retrieves the access JWT from the request, decodes it ignoring the expiration,
and verifies it against the JWT_SECRET.
It then fetches the user from the database based on the username from the decoded token.
If no user is found or the usernames do not match, it throws a 401 error.

list.title: auth.getUserRolesAndPermissions
list.description:
Retrieves the roles and permissions of a specified user from the database.
This function executes a SQL function using a data mapper to get the roles and permissions.
If the user has roles and permissions,
they are returned in an object; otherwise, null is returned.

list.title: auth.isValidRefreshToken
list.description:
Validates a user's refresh token.
The function first checks if a refresh token was provided in the request body.
If a refresh token is provided, it decodes and verifies the token.
The function then fetches the user from the database based
on the user ID from the decoded refresh token.
If the user is found, the function checks whether the username of
the found user matches the username of the provided user
and whether the provided refresh token matches the refresh token stored in the user's record.
If these conditions are met, the function returns true.
If the conditions are not met or no user is found, the function throws an error.

list.title: checkPermission
list.description: Middleware to check if the user has the required permission.

list.title: checkRole
list.description: Middleware to check if the user has the required role.

list.title: checkUserId
list.description: Middleware to check if the request's userId matches the authenticated user.

list.title: controllerHandler
list.description:
This is a middleware function that handles controllers.
It is an express middleware that wraps the controller function and catches any errors it throws,
passing them to the next middleware (usually an error handling middleware).

list.title: externalApiController
list.description: Controller for external API endpoints.

list.title: externalApiController.restCountry
list.description: Fetches data for a specific country from the RestCountry API.

list.title: externalApiController.restCountryFlags
list.description: Fetches data for all countries from the RestCountry API.

list.title: externalApiController.worldBank
list.description: Fetches data for a specific country from the World Bank API.

list.title: externalApiController.wtf
list.description: Fetches a radio for a specific country from the radioBrowser API.

list.title: fetchDataByCategory
list.description:
Fetch World Bank data by category for a specific country.

The function makes a call to the World Bank API and returns an object containing
various properties about the country like environment, population, economy, job, and education.

list.title: fetchRadioData
list.description:
Fetch radio station data for a specific country using the RadioBrowser API.

The function makes a call to the RadioBrowser API and returns an object containing
the name, url, url_resolved, and homepage of the radio station.

list.title: fetchWorldBankData
list.description:
Fetch and log World Bank data for a specific country.

The function fetches World Bank data for a specific country and logs the country data.
Returns the transformed data or null in case of an error.
